title: Sengled Pulse LED Smart Bulb with JBL Bluetooth Speaker, App Controlled Up to 8 BR30 LED Light Bulbs with Starter Kit, E26 Base, Compatible with Amazon Alexa, Pewter, 2 Pack
features: STREAM EFFORTLESSLY: Bluetooth speaker connects with Amazon Echo & Echo Dot for voice control; ask Alexa to play music from Amazon Music, Spotify, Pandora, iHeartRadio, TuneIn and SiriusXM
EASY SET UP: install into standard E26 light sockets or fixtures, download the iOS/Android app and set up. Suitable for 5 to 6 inch recessed can lighting (socket extender required for 4 inch)
HIGH FIDELITY SOUND: 13 watt (at 8 ohms) loudspeakers perform as left right stereo pair
APP CONTROLLED: stream audio, adjust the volume and set light brightness from your iOS or Android devoice
WHOLE HOME MUSIC: link up to eight (master and seven satellites) bulbs for sound everywhere; bulbs work best up to 100 feet apart

productDescription: A wireless speaker system integrated into an LED bulb. Connect with Bluetooth and stream from any mobile device.
Use the app to change light brightness, control volume separately or synchronously, and set equalizer modes . Available for iOS and Android.
Pulse Master bulb will communicate to Satellite bulbs up to 100 feet away.

Add up to 7 satellite Pulse bulbs in your lamps and recessed lighting and experience the surround sound experience. Expand your Pulse Bluetooth speaker system with additional light bulb speakers to create in-ceiling surround sound.
How To Add Satellite Bulbs to your Pulse System:

Pulse can be connected to the Amazon Alexa Devices to bring voice controlled music through your light socket via Bluetooth connection. Now you can enjoy high fidelity music without touching your phone.

Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Plus, Echo Spot, and Echo Show can all stream music to the Pulse bulb but none of them will have lighting control capabilities. To control the lights on the Pulse, you would have to use your mobile device’s Pulse App.
Create an unexpected entertaining experience with the high-quality, wireless sound system that installs into your existing light sockets!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Product, but issues you should be ready for....
reviews.reviewText: I have 5 of these throughout my apartment and they really are great for delivering music/podcasts to all the rooms. However, they run on a separate app from all the other Sengled lighting products and unfortunately, there are a lot of bugs. For one, if they are not in use - you will not be able to use the app to turn them all back on. Even if you turn the lights off with the app and leave the light switch on, the Sengled app will NOT recognize the bulbs if switched off for 30mins/hour. You have to go around to each area (starting with the master bulb) switch the lights off and on again - an then the app will pick them up. The Sengled Home app which operates their other products works seamlessly with Alexa. The app that powers these bulbs does NOT -- or at least I haven't had any luck with it. If you have the speaker bulbs and other Sengled products -- you have to use separate apps to operate them. That being said, for a small apartment, the inconvenience of flipping a few switches off and on to get the app to work isn't a huge problem -- but I would definitely think twice for a larger space. Hopefully, Sengled will get some of this worked out - it would be nice to operate all their products from one app.

I bought these for 20 bucks on sale (red master and satellite set). I am fortunate enough to have 4 farmhouse pendant lights hanging in the kitchen, which ended up being the perfect placement for both speakers (one on each end). Installed them (super-easy), loaded a playlist on my Android phone, and the next thing I knew the kitchen was really, really, REALLY clean. O_o

I will buy more satellites, maybe for the other two pendants. I may never leave my kitchen again. It's like a party going on in there!

I sure hope these last a good long time because they are an awesome addition to our home.

I used 2 of these (master and satellite) in a rec. room 15x20 with 12 6inch recessed lighting cans. What I like about theses bulbs. They fit recessed lighting cans and look good. The app features like dimming lights and using the preset eq options. The speakers sound pretty good especially the mids and highs. Able to pair speakers (subwoofer or same bulbs) and add more. Able to control sound for each speaker. Able to use bluetooth from tv, phone, tablet or any device that sends bluetooth signals. Wireless!!!! Space saving by elimating soundbars and wired satellite speakers that sit on end tables or attached to walls. What I dont like about these are: Can add only 8 total speakers. Which means I cant fill up all 12 cans and rock the house lol. Only one color option for led which is white. I would like to be able to use multi colored leds and maybe different party modes to rotate through colors and flashing lights. Overall these are great sounding speaker lights. I will be adding a sub and 2 more satellite speakers for a more complete robust sound for this room.

Wow! This is an awesome product; worth the money. Easy to install, worked immediately in my can lights; the Pulse lights are indistinguishable from ordinary light bulbs. I was worried that the light quality would be cold, but it is warm. The app is easy to use and dims the bulbs from 100 to 0. So, the light switch needs to be on for the music to play, but via the app you can turn the light source off. The master bulbs switch needs to be on for the system to work, but you can turn other satellite bulb light switches on and off to control if music is on in certain rooms. (I can have the master and satellite bulbs on in my living room, but turn off the switches in my dining room to have that room be silent.)

Just to clarify how this system works (I was a bit confused): I bought the PULSE master and satellite starter kit, then added additional Pulse satellite bulbs to get music in multiple rooms on the same floor of my house. You can have 7 bulbs linked with the master.

I initially bought the solo pro, which does not connect to other bulbs. This would be ideal if one may just want one bulb in one room, like your teenager's room or in your bathroom.
I hope this helps, this was only clear to me after consulting the chart distinguishing the differences between the various bulbs.

I use I Heart Radio and Sirius XM radio apps to play my favorite jams. This is going to make life better.

One last thing: while I was playing music, my husband happened to turn the TV on in the same room. He used a WiFi remote, and the music quality got grainy. But, when we aren't using them simultaneously, it's not an issue.

Really awesome product!

These were very easy to set up and have surprisingly good sound quality. I set up a series of them on my porch for outdoor parties. They have good volume and it's nice to be able to turn off the light portion during the day. Lights are plenty bright and do that job fine as well.

Bluetooth range isn't great relative to other bluetooth devices I own, but not enough to drop a star. Range is probably limited by how/where the device is mounted.

The app is straightforward, but sometimes takes a few tries to find the master bulb and can be annoying.

I received one satellite unit with a sound quality issue, but Amazon customer service was great as usual and it was replaced at no charge.

This is a great way to add wireless speakers without extra holes and wiring. Clever idea. I'm planning an indoor setup at some point when I can swap out my dimmer switch (these can't be installed on a dimmer).

reviews.reviewTitle: This product came with 2 bulbs and easy instructions. Screwed them into the socket and downloaded ...
reviews.reviewText: This product came with 2 bulbs and easy instructions. Screwed them into the socket and downloaded the app and presto. They work great. I got these for my office and I have one in each room and can control it with my phone. You need recessed light boxes or a lamp. People just look around and can't seem to figure out where the music is coming from. Pretty fun. The volume is just right, sounds are good and clear. I have read some reviews that say the volume wasn't very good or loud enough. I found that not to be a problem at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a Creative Product for Music Lovers!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these on a whim. Thought I would use them and then figured I would give them to my son and his spouse for a fun gift at Christmas. He wasn't sure at first and then we visited them for a family function and he had them installed and playing music and loves them. They are so easy to install and operate with the app that matches them on a smart phone. These make it so easy to have music without wiring and what is really great about them is that you can dim the lights and control the volume from the Sengled app.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to install and use- Cool product.
reviews.reviewText:
To start, I will tell you that I didn't expect fantastic stereo sound with thumping bass from these speakers- I think that would be unrealistic.
Installation was very, very easy. I may have to turn in my "man card" but I actually read the instructions and they were pretty simple. Install the "Master" bulb like any other bulb and (I have an iPhone) go to your Bluetooth settings and search for new devices- the bulb popped right up and I paired with it. This brought up a pop up screen letting me know I needed an app to use the lights so I clicked on the provided link, installed the app and I was on my way. The app is extremely easy to use as you can dim the lights, turn them on and off and even control each light individually. The music is easy too, just turn the volume up to whatever you desire, go to your iTunes and hit play on whatever you want to hear.
The speakers are fine for background music if you are having a party and you can crank it up a bit, but as I said, you are not going to rock your house with these bulb speakers, but they are not bad at all. Negatives: There is a slight buzzing sound from the Master speaker that, if you focus on it will drive you nuts. I originally tried to ignore the directions and installed the bulbs with a dimmer on my switch- big mistake as the buzzing was pretty loud and if it hadn't decreased after removing the dimmer, I would have returned these bulbs but it got much better. Second negative: you have to go to your Bluetooth settings and re-establish the connection every time you leave the room and come back in as once you lose your connection by leaving or turning the wall switch off. Also, i'd like for more than one phone to be able to operate the lights at one time....but maybe that would start a fight in my house! All in all, a very cool product that is really easy to install and use. I got so excited after installing them that I ordered two more "Satellite" bulbs and now have all the bulbs in my family room set up- the kids get a kick out of it. My gadget-phobe wife is not so excited...she preferred the dimmer switch on the wall. My daughter wants these in her room...guess I know what she is getting for her birthday.

The lights are great and have speakers have a pretty good sound. Does not sound as good as most Bose products but taking into consideration that these are LIGHT BULBS they sound great. Those who primarily play club type music which requires a lot more bass will probably want to buy the subwoofer. I listen primarily to rock type music and these deliver all of the bass I really need. Set up couldn't be easier. My phone automatically connects to them when I walk into the house. The lights come on with the switch regardless of being connected to Bluetooth. When you have music playing and a phone call comes in it automatically pauses your music and WILL NOT play your phone call over the speakers. Music resumes as soon as you hang up the phone. Truly an innovative, high quality product.

reviews.reviewTitle: No wires. No fuss. Love these lights!
reviews.reviewText: These lights / speakers are wicked awesome. They are a bit wide and they didn't fit some of my recessed light cans. I moved them to another location in my house and they fit perfectly. The sound quality is better than I expected. I bought the master and one satellite. I'm definitely going to buy a few more satellites to complete the entire house!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds Great with Great App - Not a Great Light Bulb
reviews.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised with the sound quality. Put these in my garage and they sound great. The lights are very warm/yellow though, so ironically they actually make a better speaker than a light bulb. The app is also pretty good in that you can change the volume, and most importantly set the Left/Right channels for all the speakers.

I bought this product in April 2017 and now have a total of 6. The concept is brilliant as we were looking for something that was easy to use. We had the electrician install for dimmable lights & simply screwed these and installed the app. In the beginning the ease of use was amazing! The brightest setting offers plenty of light & during the day we just turn the brightness down all of the way. It is now August 2018 and the app rarely ever picks the bulbs up. I have to try 4-5 times to start app detect the bulbs, even when I am standing right underneath of them. Sometimes it does not setect them at all. For those reasons I gave this product 3 stars.
Absolutely AWESOME! Easy to set up and work great

reviews.reviewTitle: Bluetooth only not wifi like their cousin. fair sound. Decently heavy.
reviews.reviewText: I had recently purchased so Sengled bulbs which used a wifi connection. I did not realize that these only connect via bluetooth and need the pulse app not the element home app. As with any bluetooth device you have to determine range in your home. I wish there was a bluetooth extender for these. You can not control the level of audio for the individual speakers only on and off. You can control individual light levels. I also suggest turning the lights down while enjoying your music. They get rather warm at 100 percent which I imagine shortens the devices service life. You can not schedule these like their wifi cousins to turn the lights on and off. The acoustic obviously also depend on placement and what type of fixture you place them in. There are some good adjustments in the audio settings such as designating the speaker right ,left, or both and some basic frequency settings such as classical, jazz, rock, movie, pop, and normal. Please also note that these are decently heavy and will likely topple unsupstantial desk lamps or if used on the side of a skinny floor lamp. I haven't had these long so only giving 3 stars for now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Modifying my earlier review. Good sound. Easy to set up for listening to music while I work.
reviews.reviewText: I checked and the two deliver left and right stereo sound, just as I wanted, over the Bluetooth connection. Or rather they did the first time I tried it. Then I moved them to ceiling light fixtures, _not_ on a dimmer. Now only one of them is controlled by the app. Both turn on but I can only get sound and only control brightness from one of them. The other, no sound, full brightness, does not lower when I lower brightness via the app, which the first one does. It's as if somehow the bluetooth code gets confused over whether to connect to the master or the slave. I spent ten minutes fooling with it, un-pairing, turning power on and off to the speaker/lights, rebooting the phone, re-discovering via bluetooth, nothing changes. Still only one of them controlled by the Android phone app, other one: no sound, full brightness. I don't know how but somehow the master lost the address of the satellite. I was able to re-establish using the app and the barcode reader facility and now both speakers and light level controls for both work together. I'll just add that it's easy to be lulled into thinking you don't need to read the instructions first; you can get into trouble that way!

When these types of speakers first came out they were above $100 even for the lesser brands. As time and technology has advanced the prices for older models have decreased. And that is the very reason these are a great buy. Are you going to get room filling sound that sounds like a stereo system? No
Will they light up your bedroom to replace your 100W or equivalent bulbs? No
What they are great for are setting the mood or ambiance over the kitchen island as you cook or above the bar counter in your home to sorta create your own bubble to enjoy with your partner. The sound quality is in line with a JBL Flip 3. It has bass but not overwhelming. The stereo separation depends on the distance between the satellite and master. In the kitchen they are roughly 6ft apart and over the bar counter, about 3 ft. The kitchen stereo separation is more noticeable but I actually prefer sitting under them at the bar counter.

The price is great, sound quality is good for the price, the convenience of not having to charge the lights is awesome, and the only real negative for these I can come up with is the app. The app has been neglected for some time now and it shows. From lagging to connect to change settings to not utilizing the entire scree on my Xs Max, the app shows the age of the product. If you can overlook that, but then now.

I have 3 ceiling cans in my kitchen ceiling which we had not been using very much at all because we have adequate lighting without them. I thought that my wife might enjoy some music in there which did not occupy much space and she could manipulate easily with her iPhone or iPad and the same for me... A 10 minute hookup tops and we were in business with the third receptacle holding the Wi-Fi boost light. The music was terrible until I got the eq, and the Pulse sound regulated with the basic sound from the ios device and it improved to the point that it is totally enjoyable in spite of the fact that it will never knock you down with bass....We are very pleased with these items.

reviews.reviewTitle: YES IT SYNCS TO ALEXA AS A SPEAKER
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this for the sole purpose of using it with Alexa. You CAN pair it with Alexa. But only to use as a speaker. Here is how:

To install these bulbs to your phone you need to download the Sengled Pulse app.
Instructions in the app tells you to connect to the bulbs through your phones Bluetooth.
It works and you can now control the light and play music (and other phone sounds) through the speakers.

To connect to Alexa you HAVE TO DISCONNECT YOUR PHONES BLUETOOTH FROM THE BULBS.
The bulbs only allow one Bluetooth to be paired at the time. Go to your phones Bluetooth settings and disconnect.
Open the Alexa app, choose the echo device on your list that you want to pair the bulbs with. Under wireless pair with a new device. Let it search for one and the bulbs should now be on the list!

You have to disconnect and reconnect Alexa/your phone to use the light setting.

Hope that helps!

This is the first time I've been disappointed with a Sengled product. This bulb/speaker combo is a great idea, but the features and performance fall way short of meeting expectations.
1. The sound quality poor
2. They cannot be controlled by your Sengled hub, or the Sengled app, or Alexa, or Google home, or anything other than the "Pulse app."
3. The "Pulse app" is lame.
4. You cannot control the lights while the speakers are bluetooth paired with anything other than your phone with "Pulse app."
5. They run way hotter than a LED bulb should, especially in can lighting.
***I would like to observe a moment of silence for the unfortunate souls who paid $200+ when these first hit the market a few years back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super short range defeats most use cases...
reviews.reviewText: The range on these is less than half the advertised 10 meters. Specifically any master and satellites would need to be in the same room inside about 15 feet to function properly. This makes the idea of one master and 7 satellite speakers just silly since no surround sound methods are supported and every bulb would need to be inside the same smallish room. The sound is good and a home theater rig in overhead cans or lamps would deliver decent stereo along with dimmable lights, but the lights themselves do not support any colors other than a warm soft white lighting which doesn't match my cool daylight themed home at all. Installation for the pre-linked pair is as simple as connecting a bluetooth device to it. Other satellite speakers can be added by downloading the app and linking from there. The app can control volume and brightness for each individual speaker/light. Overall, it's a solid idea, but using something like powerline or WiFi to interconnect these units for multi-room sound would work way better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor design, poor sound quality. A waste of your money.
reviews.reviewText:
I return this product because, 1) it was randomly disconnecting from Bluetooth an a real pain to reconnect, 2) the size of the bulb is giant and I could not find a lamo that it would fit in and still allow me to reinstall the shade, 3) the sound d quality at best a 2.

All in all it was a waste of money especially since I could not get it to fit into a lamp or keep it connected to Bluetooth.

My advice for those considering this product is to look elsewhere and spend a little more. You will not be happy with this purchase.

Finally, since my review is so negative, I'll bet this review never gets posted.

These things are REALLY COOL! What a neat idea and for the most part very good implementation. The speaker is impressively clear and loud. I will say the bass is somewhat lacking but what can you expect from such a small speaker?!

First...why I gave this only 3 stars - The bulbs I received have different shades of light. They are right next to each other and one is noticeably whiter than the other one is. This is disappointing and somewhat annoying as they really need to be the same color light. The second reason I gave this 3 stars is because the first set I received had one bulb with damaged threads and I couldn't screw it into the socket. My iPhone pairs right away every time but my wifes Galaxy S7 often struggles to pair.

Why I'd like to give this 5 stars - These bulbs have about a 65w equivalent light and they have speakers in them! The bluetooth works well on my iPhone. You can download an app to further control volume and dimming functionality but the app is not necessary if you just want to play music, you can use the volume buttons on your phone to adjust the speaker volume. The app also allows you to turn the lights off while still playing music and you can assign a speaker as the Left or Right speaker or have them both play stereo. This light fit nicely into a 6" recessed can. The second set came with socket extensions and plastic thread protectors for shipping...maybe I wasn't the first to get a bulb with a bad thread.

I am truly impressed by the speaker, the app, and the idea but...a light bulbs first job must be to provide light and this product just missed the mark on that since the bulbs aren't the same color light.

I would really like to see this product line expanded into brighter LEDs. Also, they have the SOLO line that would be great for lamps but I wish they had those same bulbs that could pair together. I'd definitely buy those for the bedroom!

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud and bright but mediocre operating software..
reviews.reviewText:
Bought these satellites because my buddy ordered two mains by accident and didn’t have use for the extra one.
I’ve had them kicking around and hadn’t had the time to install them. Last week I put them in a fixture.
First off, if your looking for a bulb that is aesthetically pleasing to the eye, don’t buy this. It’s just not pretty to look at but would be great in a garage or man cave. They’re very loud, the sound is great for the size of the speaker. The down fall is that there’s a delay in the sound from the main to the satellite. It’s not a big delay, but it’s definitely noticeable. Maybe if I had the speakers in different rooms it wouldn’t be as pertinent.. another downside is the Pulse app you need to download to use the functions of the light. It’s very slow to connect to the speakers and every time you exit the app to do anything on your phone, it needs to search for the lights again to connect and it takes a while. Not bad if you just need to leave a playlist on for a while but if you need to use them a lot like normal bulbs it can definitely be a nuisance. 1 star based on my personal experience.

The biggest disapointment was the light cannot be controlled by my existing hub nor by the echo device. It. can only be controlled via the singled pulse app and make sure you connect to it via Bluetooth and also buggy. You can only add the speaker part as a Bluetooth speaker for the echo device. Oh and if you have some older existing lamp socket, it does not fit because of its shape. in other words it does not fit all BR30 sockets especially the older ones.

not recommended but I've installed two of them in a small restroom so I could listen to news articles while I take a shower.

The adjustable light help if you want 10% light just for the middle of night and it can get pretty bright in a small room.

However be audio always resets to 80% when you turn the power off. Requiring the app 2 set the volume to 100%.

These were unable to be use for a wireless smart home use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good idea, low volume and bad sync make this a pass.
reviews.reviewText: Set up was easy but I found that the range and volume was not what I was expecting. I have four of these in two rooms in my house. The sound is only ok, I have a TDK speaker that I take around with me that has much better sound and a greater range. But I'm always losing the charger for it, so I though these would be great to have in various places in my house. Unfortunately they don't have the volume to replace my TDK speaker. While it's true that I could use more of the Senglet units together to make it louder, that would require purchasing more per room than just carrying my portable speaker with me. Also two of the receptacles I placed these bulbs in block all Bluetooth signal. What's the point of having these if they can't receive the signal. Also they are supposed to remember the last light level you had them at but frequently they don't and therefore go back to 100% brightness. I place one in my bathroom and set the brightness quite low, in the hopes that middle of the night bathroom visits would not blind me. No such luck, the unit is always resetting to full brightness. Such a pain. The sycronization between units is also a pain, if the other units are not on when the master unit is started then you can't add them to the group, they have to be on first. I like the idea of these bulbs but the tech just isn't there yet. Maybe in a few years I'll look into a system like this again but for now, I'm not happy with them.

Pros.
It's a light. It's a speaker. Duh. It's fun.
Loud enough.

Pro tip- leave the light switch on (unit light off via app) to use speakers whenever you want. If and when you want the lights on and you don't want to dig through your phone, switch the wall light switch off and on again to turn on the lights.

Cons.
Does not work on a dimmer switch. You must change out the dimmer switch to a convention switch.

Sounds nasally.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bulb didnt work and return was difficult and a waste of time
reviews.reviewText: I already had one set of these and i liked them so I bought a second set. The satelite bulb stoppes working within the first 48 hours of use. I contacted amazon (of whi h i but quite a lot of things from) and was treated like an utter dolt. They wanted to run me through a set by step trouble shooting process ( ive been in manufacturing,maintenance, and repair for about two decades) and when i explained that i had thourghly trouble shot the product they refused to except that i was capable of doing so. Finally they wanted to put me in contact with the manufacture; which they did. The manufacture wanted to run me through the same process to which i refused, eventually they sent me an email telling me to take pictures and give a written explanation of the problem. I did not do that because I'm done wasting my time (other than this review). I no longer want a replacement so good job. Ill just take the loss and buy a similar product from another manufacture. I really wanted the speaker to be wifi anyhow but this company has definitely lost my business (im sure they don't care anyhow).

over all this product does work well. The biggest downside is you need a phone to use them and if the lights wont link to the app on the phone then they are just regular bulbs. I installed theses in my living room can lights and run my Roku through them for surround sound. You do not need to buy anything special to link the TV audio to the light if you have a ROKU device and the Roku app on your phone. You can set the ROKU app to private listen which will then stream to your phone and then to the lights. Some times the sound doesn't sync perfectly fraction of a second really but beats spending tons of $$$ to do the same thing otherwise

Works awesome for the money and super easy to connect and no issues so far. Beware of negative reviews - seems like they are having issues with their connecting device (low quality phones) or simply don't understand. They will sound about 10x better than any speaker on any phone - Bathroom fills with sound. Great simple APP that allows you to control an EQ and light brightness. Sounds as good as my $40 portable bluetooth speaker BUT these fill the room with sound much better (assuming you separate them). Enjoy!

I like the easy installation, and easy set up.
But...........
The sound is nothing close to what I thought it would be since It had a JBL speaker. I bought a 12.00 bulb two summers ago. It sounds better, and you can change the color, and the light moves to the music , which these don’t.
I have the satellite and master set. Not impressed at all. If I were JBL, I’d be embarrassed to have my product in these lights

reviews.reviewTitle: Absolutely loved them when I bought them less than two months ...
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely loved them when I bought them less than two months ago. Now it appears as if the Master bulb has failed. I liked it so much I bought two more satellites and the subwoofer module. I’m hoping sengled can get this resolved for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good add-on for your office or bedroom
reviews.reviewText: One of my best friend told me about this product. It is something which will make people ask you where the sound is coming from, because almost 90% of people wont be able to guess if it is the bulb playing the music. It is a good deal for the price your paying but im not happy with this product. Installation was very easy but connecting your phone or tablet with these bulbs is a pain on day to day basis. Overall not a bad buy and give it try. It will not give the hifi base, if you want you can connect a woofer but need to buy a connect hub which is sold separately.

By far on of the best value purchases I’ve made this year! I installed these in can light fixtures above my patio. They are under a overhang roof with full protection from the weather. The sound quality from the JBL speakers is tremendous. The ease of installation is like changing a light bulb. Once installed they are flush mounted to surface of the ceiling and very attractive. Good light source as well. No complaints

Wow!! 4 minutes from box to playing! Screw the bulbs in, download App and pair. Easy peezy! The sound is amazing as well! Now I'm jammin' out in four rooms at once! My master closet, laundry room, master bedroom and bath are now in sync! No more changing speaker selections on bluetooth every time I go into the next room! 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 oh and did I mention Alexa compatible? Yep!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product for the money and would recommend
reviews.reviewText: I do wish they were slightly brighter but for how inexpensive they are they’re excellent.I used these to Bluetooth to a smart tv and have surround sound and they do an excellent job at it.Sound quality is fairly good considering it’s a light bulb,no real bass but I’m not having concert or expecting artillery shelling to sound completely realistic.I’m gonna buy a set for the garage so I can have some tunes while wrenching.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super simple whole house music solution
reviews.reviewText:
This is frikkin rad!

OK, don't expect "theater quality sound" from these speakers (hence a 4 star)

The setup was simple. The sound across the house is sync. The kids are dancing. Light bulbs and sound are controlled through master and individual. So if you reduce ONE speaker, THEN reduce the total sound, they all respond proportionately.

Seriously, this is super simple and COMPLETELY worth playing with, We are hosting a birthday party for a friend in a couple weeks, and now I can have music throughout the entire house (and yard) with no effort or tech support at all.

GET THIS!

(oh, and the light part is serviceable also. It works well. That's not why I bought it, but it is something pretty cool to play with too)

reviews.reviewTitle: I happened across an excellent review of these lights/speakers on CNET
reviews.reviewText:
While in the process of renovating the master bedroom in my home, I happened across an excellent review of these lights/speakers on CNET. Since I was updating the bedroom, I thought it would be fun to add some technological flair with a light and speaker combo. See pictures below.

I was excited about this genius new idea to combine lights AND speakers in one item. However, upon installing the lights, I was genuinely disappointed.

Let me first say that the lights are in fact incredibly easy to install. You literally screw them in to light sockets. They are rather large, but I had anticipated that, and purchased gas light shades that would hide the bulbs. They do NOT work on dimmer switches, and I knew that beforehand. They produce a nice, incandescent-quality light with a fairly smooth dimming range. The sound quality is mediocre and tinny, and I was hoping for much more based on reviews I had read.

Here are my peeves with this item:

In order to connect to the lights/speakers, you must go in to settings > bluetooth and connect to the device EVERY time you leave range. It does not automatically reconnect after leaving range. That is just to use the speakers.
To control the lights, you download the Pulse app. Ok, no big deal. But if I want to turn on the lights, I have to go to settings > bluetooth, connect to the lights. Then I have to open the Pulse app (I usually wait 10 or so seconds before opening it, because I find if I open the app immediately after connecting to bluetooth, I end up waiting indefinitely), and then the Pulse app needs to do its own connection to the lights. From there, you can control the lights. Turning on the lights generally takes ~35 seconds (I timed it). To me, this is completely impractical as a primary light source in any space.

Only one device can be connected to the lights/speakers at any time, so if my husband wants to turn out his light while we're in bed, it can only be done on my phone.

There is a no Apple Watch compatibility as of yet.

I haven't found any other apps that work specifically with these lights/speakers. For instance, I have a sleep app that can work with Phillips HUE lights to gradually turn on the lights to wake you up.

In essence, this is a mixed review. These lights are not good as a primary dimmable light source (unless you have something like a spare iPod to be used as a dedicated dimmer switch). They might serve some purpose in a living room with no surround sound system where you want to add some dimmable spotlights in an area.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nothing like this on the market, really great!
reviews.reviewText:
Great! I bought this set (master + satellite), and then another pair of satellites to expand the system. I don't think it's necessarily expensive, since it's hard to compare - there's really nothing quite like it on the market. Unlike many music speaker/LED lightbulb combinations, these link, meaning one phone can play the same song to up to 8 of these.

There's a simple to use iPhone App. There's also an Android version, although I didn't try that myself. The app lets you connect to the bulbs. Pairing is easy... the master shows up as a Bluetooth device, so you pair to it from your phone's settings menu just like you would a headset, a bluetooth portable speaker, or your car. From there, the app takes over, and you can add extra satellite lights either by entering in the code from the bulb, or scanning a QR-code with your phone's camera to automate the process without typing - time saver!

The app let's you control a cluster of up to 8 lights. You can turn them on and off, or control dimming from "0-100%" (it's really more like 0-10 since the increments aren't very smooth). You can also control the volume of the speakers. From the app, you can control ALL lights at once, or bulbs individually (so dim all bulbs, or dim bulb #2 for example). Each bulb can be labeled for ease of use, i.e.: "Family Room Front Right".

In addition, each bulb is stereo, but can be assigned to play stereo, or just the left channel or right channel. If you have the right room layout, the stereo effect is greatly enhanced if you set a bulb to be just right and another to be just left.

Now for the cons... although I just took away one star, because frankly, this is an emerging market, and all products are new.

1) I wish you could group lights by room. So rather than control ALL lights, or ONE light, I could control the "Family Room". I may eventually buy another master speaker and just split up the bulbs, but it'd be nice if you could just do this from the app.

2) I wish it was compatible with something else... anything else. Zigbee... Insteon... WeMo... Hue... anything. We have Iris by Lowe's for security, since we got a pretty good deal on the kit. We also have a thermostat for the Iris, so one app controls alarm and temperature. I'd like to add lights to the system... and while Iris isn't compatible with tons of bulbs, Pulse is compatible with nothing else. So if I added regular bulbs, I might end up with THREE apps to control things. Some more vendor interoperability here would be nice. Or Pulse could keep going their own way... but they need to come out with plain LED bulbs that control themselves from the same app... but don't have a speaker and a $80 price tag.

3) These are BIG. In a table lamp, it'd be fine, since it's all concealed behind the lamp shade. In our ceiling, they hang down a quarter inch past our recessed opening, whereas a normal flood bulb sits flush.

But... if you've read this far.. here's the big PLUS...

Nothing sounds this good! The quality of music coming out of our ceiling is pretty darn good. Granted, I don't have a ton to compare it against... but it sounds better than the overhead music in department stores. It sounds about as good as my older Jawbone bluetooth speaker, but not quite as good as my father's Bose bluetooth speaker. It's a solid performer, and if you have enough (our family room has 4 overhead lights, and we have Pulse in all 4 of them and the room just sounds great.

I'm not an audiophile, but the best way I can sum it up is, while it's not a high end home theater sound, it's good enough that I can tell the difference between the low resolution free Pandora audio vs a higher bit rate MP3 from my iTunes collection. So there is some real fidelity there.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome little speakers, for being a lightbulb!
reviews.reviewText: More than satisfied with this purchase. Definitely planning on getting more since they've apparently had a huge price break I was unaware of. You won't regret getting these bulbs/speakers.

If you are a gadget person, you just need to buy these lights. I want more people to buy them so they'll keep making them and the price will come down and every light in my house will be one of these. This is a genius idea, with a very good implementation on the speaker side. In fact, on the speaker side, I give these a 5 for sound. Add Sonos integration and then you have 5 across the board on speakers. As pure lights, they're also a 5 -- no start up delay, nice color temperature. But at this price point, I want more than just light, I'd like Hue-type color change, synced to the music. Then, I'd give this a full on 5.

As I said above, the sound is pretty darn good. Not going to be very bassy, but it has good volume, good sound even at low volume, and all in all good sound. People are blown away when they realize the music is not coming from some hidden speaker in the ceiling, but from the light bulb.

Also, incredibly easy to set up and use. Screw in, download app, launch Bluetooth, play. That's really it.

reviews.reviewText:

I love it when technology solves a problem. I installed these on a porch that had recessed lights and no dimmer options. They work great, have excellent sound, and are simple to control.

Ingenious concept, but I had to return them because they didn’t work in my situation. Currently, I have an Amazon Echo that I love but I would like to hear it through my house. Sonos has a wireless speaker system that looks like it would do the trick but for $200-$500 per speaker it is more than I’m willing to spend. Putting a few light bulbs that double as speaker looks the best and simplest idea ever. Note, you have to have an “Echo Dot” to connect Bluetooth speakers—the original and tap do not allow Bluetooth speaker.

Pros:
1. Simple to install.
2. Nice application for changing light and speaker volume.
3. The only multi bulb speaker on the market so far in May 2016. Don’t be fooled by the other light bulbs that claim multiple bulbs can be put in “Bluetooth groups”. Yes, other bulbs can be put in “Bluetooth groups” but sound will only come out from one light bulb at a time. It is a hard limitation of the current Bluetooth design.

Acceptable:
The sound quality is okay but face it: it is a speaker inside of a light bulb. You can buy a subwoofer for the system if you require better sound fidelity.

Cons:
1. The distance for wireless is less than 30 feet. 30 feet might be acceptable for an apartment but it is far too small for a house. My plan was for speakers in the kitchen, shower, master bedroom, and living room. The closest two rooms were my kitchen and bathroom. The light sockets were 27 feet apart which was too far for the wireless speaker. :( Why couldn’t they use my current house WiFi to transmit the sound?
2. You can only connect one device at a time to the speakers. This is an issue because I connected it to my Amazon Echo. Once connected to my Echo I could not connect my android device to change the volume or light intensity.
3. They are not compatible with Amazon Echo voice commands. For example you cannot use echo to control the light intensity. Sengled is designing their own “Voice” light bulb so I doubt the will spend any effort on making these compatible with Echo.
4. As far as I can tell there is only a master volume and light intensity control. You cannot have some lights on and others dimmed or off.

Suggestions:
This is the coolest concept I’ve seen this year. If it used a better wireless connection that could cover my whole house, and allowed a phone app to connect while it was playing music on another device I would have keep them regardless of the sound quality. If they added a microphone and made the bulb Amazon Echo compatible it would be the greatest item ever. Imagine being able to give Echo commands anywhere in your house. It could even be smart enough to play the answer on the light bulb that heard the question, or turn on any lights that heard “Alexa lights.”

reviews.reviewTitle: The Sengled Pulse is pretty much everything as advertised
reviews.reviewText:
The Sengled Pulse is pretty much everything as advertised. I have two installed in my office, replacing the bulbs in two of four in-ceiling can lights. I connected them to my computer rather than to my phone. I do not use the dimming feature.

On the plus side, their light is almost a 100% match to the other two in-ceiling lights. Their sound is pretty good, too. I may try pairing them with a subwoofer at some point to balance out the sound.

On the down side, the bulbs do not come on immediately with the other lights; there is a 2 second or so delay. The bulbs do not protrude from the can, but the light is lower than the other two bulbs. These are very minor considerations.
Came fast and worked great.

I guess the brick wall in between stopped the signal.

I am absolutely fascinated by how cool these speakers are. I have been looking for some way to have Bluetooth music in our master bath without having to have a stereo on the countertop. These work well in my 'Man Cave', and outside in my yard as background music at parties, or relaxing in the hot tub. Being able to control the light intensity and the sound level from my smartphone is great.

Simple to set up. Easy to use. Sound quality exceeded expectation!

I was hopeful that this would be an impressive product. The concept is great, but the sound quality is dreadful Honestly, if I strapped a couple of alarm clock radios to the ceiling I think they'd sound about the same as these Sengled speakers. I was really surprised about the poor audio quality given that the drivers are supplied by JBL but, in fairness, the drivers are very small and therefore, realistically incapable of producing high quality, room filling, sound.

I spoke with Sengled customer service and they confirmed that a WiFi version is currently available in Europe, but not the US. Perhaps the WiFi connectivity (which is used by higher-end units like Sonos) may result in better quality than the Bluetooth transmission these units employ.

The corresponding app was simple to use and set-up was very easy using the QR code scan feature built into the app.

Lighting control through the app was also good, with reliable and quick on/off and very responsive dimming capability. One important aspect to note - the light temperature is 2700K, which puts these units at the very low end of the soft white range and makes them noticeably contrasting to the more common soft level of around 3000K. I'd recommend checking the color temperature of any existing can lights you'd want to match, as these will look strange if placed in a group that's not very closely similar to 2700K.

Bottom line - lights and speakers, in an inexpensive configuration like this ($99 for the pair), probably just aren't going to impress too many people if reasonably high-end audio is expected. Praise to Sengled for trying, but oops for the result.

I read the review by the other buyer "nokia6230" before I placed the order. He wrote: "Any light music (classical, light jazz) would be no good for them, either. The pauses in light music exacerbated the buzzing sound of the speakers. "

I found he was right about the buzzing sound. I found the buzzing sound is very annoying to my ears when there is no music or low volume. Also because I installed mine in the bathroom: the ceiling is low, room is small and we usually play light music in bathroom.

Buzzing sound aside, the units itself looks good build quality and the sound quality is good: quite rich and good depth. It should be good for large room, patio or other places where the buzzing sound will blend into normal background noise.
Good product. The sound quality is a little muffled.
Easy to use and great sound.

My wife never could figure out where the new stereo was! I had to point out the odd-looking lights in the ceiling. Set-up was just like pairing to any other device. Sound quality is reasonable for the size/power.
Works the way it's supposed to.
great product, simple and creates great atmospheres

AMAZING QUALITY FOR SIZE, however wish they could have more base or maybe have a sub light that would go with the lights... or a great suggestion to have it sync with other devices like tv, xbox, etc.

I bought the Master/Slav combo, plus an extra speaker. Sounded grat dor about 2 days and only used for a very short time. Came ho e from work and wanted to hear some music and what i heard was statically sounding music, then th speakers went off. Tried rebooting, unplugging, and nothing works. Buyer beware

reviews.reviewTitle: Great buy. Will be purchasing more
reviews.reviewText: So easy to set up with the app. Sound quality is actually pretty amazing and clear. Great buy for the price will be ordering more for the rest of my house. Light is bright and didn't comprise the lighting in my rooms buy removing original builds. Fits perfectly in our can lights

So, I reviewed these and was looking to replace my worn out beats pill. I was all set to buy a Bose SoundLink mini when a friend told me about these. We are no longer friends! Have you ever heard those Hondas with the street can mufflers, then heard a Lamborghini? Yeah that's the difference between these speakers in a can and a Bose. These are strait up junk. It hurts my ears to turn them on. They are muffled and resonate only the highs. There is no bass at all and only the snare drum can be heard. Okay so I'm not only going to pick on the sound quality. The app...lol oh the app is trash. Everytime I go in it shuts down. When it does fire up, it has to search for the bulbs again. Only one device at a time can control the lights and the sound. So I linked then to my phone and my kitchen tab. When the tab is playing the music the phone can't do anything. I know that most Bluetooth devices are like this, but most Bluetooth devices don't control lights and sound. I was looking forward to JBL speakers in the house. But man what a letdown.

You have to have light anyway, you might as well make your bulbs awesome. Get ready to pipe you music through Bluetooth technology into your lighting! JVC is a reputable manufacturer. I had function hiccups with older iOS versions, but nothing recently.
Good product

reviews.reviewTitle: Great in theory, but the technology is not there yet.

The master bulb works fine, but with the satellite bulbs, the music goes in and out, and never seems to stay consistent. Every time someone walks under the bulb, the music will cut in and out as well. For the price paid, not too thrilled. Other than that, it is a good product - but if I wanted music in one room, I'd just use the speaker on my iPhone.

These sound great when they work. Unfortunately that's not often. They cut out constantly and it takes longer to get your phone to connect to them than the time you actually get to sit and listen to the music.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below

reviews.reviewTitle: Not great in 5 inch recessed can lights...
reviews.reviewText: Tight fit for 5inch recessed cans. They stick out and bass is very weak. I have a feeling they were designed for larger 6inch cans to get a bit more bass. LED light quality very good. I decided a portable Bluetooth speaker would be better for the space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Think carefully about your level of expectation.
reviews.reviewText: Great marketing...not so great execution. If I was JBL, I’m not sure I’d have lent my name to these. Sending back. Will wait for Apple HomePod or get another high quality product when developed. In all fairness, the functions work as advertised...IOW lights go on and off as sides sound, but the sound quality is poor. A conversation piece for sure, just not a must have.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but always room for improvement
reviews.reviewText: Would be nice if there were a wall switch accessory that would allow you to turn the volume up and down without having to reach for the phone every time. Other than that the sound quality is awesome, controls are easy to use and well worth the price paid.
I have to leave them off, they produce an electric static sound if no music is going thru.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great setup. Only issue is not being able to ...
reviews.reviewText: Great setup. Only issue is not being able to adjust volume between bulbs. The master is louder than the other.

reviews.reviewTitle: These are just awesome. The sound isn't the best ever but not ...

I bought another set so I had a full set across my bar but i cant play all four together. there a set of two. So i have one set in the kitchen & one set at my covered patio. The dimmable lights are awesome too.

Pretty awesome tech. Only problem was they did not fit in my recessed lighting casing in my kitchen. I'm using them outside on my deck and they sound great. Will need to pull inside if weather gets bad, but pretty impressed with the sound coming from 2 small speakers.
After reading the reviews and seeing they were luke-warm, I decided to still give them a chance. It's a great idea, but I feel they still have some improving to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cannot be used with any dimmer-switch fixture, so buyer ...
reviews.reviewText: Cannot be used with any dimmer-switch fixture, so buyer be alert to that. I had to give these away.

These little bulbs are amazing. A bit pricey and bulky but they pack a nice punch.
I installed these in my two lamps on either side of my bed. I used the iPad Bluetooth and quickly connected without any trouble. It also directed me to the app need to operate the lights. My biggest complaint is the are BIG. About twice the size of a standard bulb. I had to manipulate the brackets on both lamps and squeeze them in at an angle. They are still not seeded correctly but I made them work. ( both lamps are medium size)

The light is a clean soft white 2600 lum ... Reminds me of natural daylight. The LEDs produce a very low high frequency hum. Slightly noticeable in a very quiet setting but not overwhelming. It's hard to avoid that sound with LEDs. The dimmer on the app works perfectly. Love it in my bed side setting!

Having both bulbs on either side of the bed produce a surprising crisp solid sound. These little things actually Rock! The app comes with 8 presettings rock, jazz, ect. I have to say that the sound quality is very very good. I was able to play pandora as well as play music right off the iPad. Any sound produced by the pad comes out of the bulbs including games as well.

These bulbs are very cool and can be used in any dry location. Besides the bulky install i have really enjoyed these neat little gadgets.

reviews.reviewTitle: Connected to Alexa, sounds great for size
reviews.reviewText: Connected to Alexa, works great, nice sound.
nice...good vendor.

reviews.reviewTitle: My son thinks they are amazing, my husband wishes they were AirPlay instead of ...
reviews.reviewText: I have bought 2 sets of these as gifts. My son thinks they are amazing, my husband wishes they were AirPlay instead of Bluetooth
Works as advertised and flawlessly. The jbl speakers pack quite a punch. The lights are bright and connected in seconds to my iPhone. Thinking of getting more to create whole house stereo.
First set did not work. Vendor had no customer support phone number, but Amazon quickly replaced them. Second set work great.

reviews.reviewTitle: THIS IS NOT A SMART DEVICE, SIMPLY A BLUETOOTH DEVICE
reviews.reviewText: THIS WILL NOT CONNECT/hook to the Alexa Plus, THIS IS NOT A SMART DEVICE, SIMPLY A BLUETOOTH DEVICE!!!!!! SO ****CAUTION****
Sound quality is not good at all.

These speaker/lights rank near the top on my hipster tech list! The JBL speakers sound great and the LED's come on bright (unlike my CFL bulbs that have to warm up) and produce no heat and are more energy efficient. I was looking for a Bluetooth speaker but didn't want another item cluttering up my kitchen counter top. I am able to listen to music from my iPad, iPod and Android phone. The app is simple & intuitive and lets you dim the lights and adjust volume control. I love showing them off to friends and guests....everyone raves about them.
Love them, kinda p!ssed that they don't make them in daylight as well, only soft white :(

They didn't work! Screwed them into the can light socket...nothing! Didn't even work as a light!
I screwed the regular LED can light bulb back in, and it worked fine. So...did I get a bum set?

reviews.reviewTitle: The speakers might work good but not these
reviews.reviewText: This is the second time im having to return this product ,both times they did not work (bluetooth) light worled
Great sound and easy to use. Would be better to advertise what is needed or available components. I wanted TV hooked to it which i now need another peice not sold seperately

These speakers are great just as pictured and just as described, very dynamic sound, I took out the bulbs in my bathroom light fixture and instlled these, I use the app to turn the lights off and crank the music while I take a bath, so nice and so invisible, just screw in place and instant light and music, I highly recommend.
Easy set up and works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool product, to many little annoying problems. Would not recommend.
reviews.reviewText:
Great idea, but unfortunately annoying little issues. Bought the bulbs to place in my bathroom but the noise of the bulbs drove me crazy. They make a high pitched humming sound. I figured maybe the wiring in my bathroom is weird, maybe noise on the ground etc. So i opted to try them in the kitchen with the same result.

The sound was decent quality,but you could still hear the humming of the bulb. I would have to turn the volume up 100% to drown out the humming.

The free downloadable app is ok. But unfortunately it doesn't always connect to the lights. But it does have cool features like being able to dim the bulbs.

Connecting to my phones blue tooth and using Pandora or Iheart to play music was extremely simple. But all the other issues are making me return these bulbs.
Works great.
Hoped the sound woul have been better
I like it. Pretty cool. Let's now see how they last
Gave them to my husband he loved them. Said best gift ever
Yes I'll need 2 get more so there is more sound.
Not. Worth. The. Money. Sound like a tin can. Buy a $10 one and you'll be just as happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't work with Nvidia Shield (Android TV)
reviews.reviewText: These sound great, but I can't use them because they don't work with my Nvidia Shield (Android TV). I tried everything (tried even using my phone as a redirect, but it can't cast to both the speakers and my shield at the same time). These would be great for a home theater setup if they only worked.
One of them bunt after I plugged it in
The sound is amazing, The color temp of the lights is fine. The connectivity is terrible.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer Beware: Returned, Non-Working Item Sold as New
reviews.reviewText: The system works great, and I am a fan. However, this one-star review was fully earned by Sengled+ for its business practices. I ordered two satellites, and one item arrived and works fine. The other item was received in the same shipment but was in an open box (not shrink-wrapepd like the other one) and never worked after many attempts to pair it. It appears to have been returned by an earlier purchaser who could not get it to work and then Sengled+ sold as new. It's very deceptive and disappointing to have old broken products sold as new.
super product
Horrible I just got any have to send back because the Bluetooth doesn't work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Please do not waste your money
reviews.reviewText: Please do not waste your money. This is not a JBL product. I unboxed it screwed it in it will not link to my phone. I called JBL and they even said this is not a JBL product. So I went on to the JBL website and they do not sell this. If I could give this zero Stars I would. Thanks have a great day hope you have better luck...
Not good
These require an app in order to adjust volume, etc. I never could get the app to download.

They sound just like the speakers at any store/ mall. If you're not expecting superb sound quality, these would do the job. The iPad's speakers gave better sound than these at eye level but I suspect it's because the iPad was right infront of me.

Any light music (classical, light jazz) would be no good for them, either. The pauses in light music exacerbated the buzzing sound of the speakers. Rock, Rap, Alt music was no problem, though. Even talk radio came in crisp and bright.

The LED light was just as bright, if not brighter, than the bulbs that I replaced.

If the dimmer switch is not the one that it requires, it would start pulsing the light on/ off and not work properly. Which leads me to why it's only two stars for me.. The dimmer can only be controlled by the iOs app. An iOs app that needs to be 7.0 or above. I mean, really? No backwards compatibility for lower iOs's? So what happens when they upgrade the iOs a couple of years down the road? That would render this thing useless when the app becomes obsolete.

Sure, you can still control the sound and light (on/ off) via the manual controls but if you were thinking of using this with the iOs app, you'd have to budget for a newer phone every couple of years. Not sure how this would pertain to the Android app.

Also, I would need to update this later but I don't think the unit has a memory function. So if I set the dimmer switch on the wall at max power and controlled the light via the iOS app to 50% light, it would not remember that once the unit was turned off.

It would be nice to have it at a set volume and light level everytime you turned it on.

UPDATE:
So the iOs app controls the dimmer, volume (set which is left, right, or stereo for both, or just turn either off), and the equalizer. The equalizer made a huge difference in sound quality.

I do not understand the positive reviews. Sound quality is mediocre at beast. Not able to adjust treble or bass. Nothing different than my iHome. Bluetooth inconsistent even with direct line of sight. Tried with different devices but still same problem. Not worth the cost. Based on sound quality and function should cost 1/4 of current price.

These seemed like a great product, and I was excited to receive them and get them setup. Unfortunately, both speakers arrived with the threaded screw bases smashed and unable to screw in to a socket. Be wary of poor quality materials and construction of this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very large, Annoying to use. Bright & limited use.
reviews.reviewText:
We bought 2 pair of these on a Lightening deal. We have 'Can' lights throughout our house. We'd hoped to use these to play our Blue Tooth enabled Satellite Radio. We currently use wireless speakers.
They do work but have annoying features. The units are so long they extend flush with the ceiling in a standard contractors Can light. The LED bulbs are Very bright so that these units are almost blinding anywhere in the room or hallway unless you turn them below 25%. We currently use 11w, 56 SMD 5730 LED flood light bulbs in these Can fixtures. But they're 1/3 to 1/4 as long as these Sengled Pulse units so the 11w floods provide nice light without blinding you unless you're directly under them and look up. The LEDs in the Sengled Pulse are built right next to the bottom of the unit so you're looking directly at the LEDS from anywhere in the room or hallway. Very Bright to the point of being blinding.
The Satellite units don't work well if it's more than about 12 ft. from the Master unit. Total dropout after 20 ft. separation.
We are unable to get either Master Unit to 'pair' with my wife's iPhone 6 Plus and yes we downloaded the iPhone App. Her iPhone works fine with our other wireless speakers and other Bluetooth devices, just not these.
Whenever you turn them on, they come on at 100% brightness and volume. So when you turn them on you have to adjust the brightness and volume again - every time you turn them on.
Bottom-line, these are too annoying for us to use. We packed them up and will donated them to Goodwill.
If I hadn't bought them on a Lightening deal for 50% off, I'd be going to the trouble of returning them.

4 Star because I knew what I was getting, and because of VALUE FOR $30 for PAIR!

Let me start by saying I knew what I was getting when I ordered these, and thats a good thing because if you have never heard these before you could wind up disappointed. Speaker wise, these lack a low end and any bass at all so be prepared for that. If you like ‘smart home’ stuff and like the idea that there would be no obvious speaker but something hidden(like me) these are right up your alley just be prepared for no low end/bass as far as sound.

At $30 for the pair(what they now cost) these bulbs really are great. I couldnt imagine paying retail when they were once $100 or more. The sound can get quite loud when multiple bulbs are paired and in use(I have two currently set up for stereo). The stereo effect sounds good, the mids and highs sound good but there is no low end or bass. the sound is clear, and the volume can really get loud. The brightness of the light does lack a bit, but its not bad and the ability to dim on a switch I dont normally have a dimmer is nice. The application could use some streamlining and updates to become more user friendly and faster but its ok and gets the job done with a little patience.

The bulbs themselves are an easy install like any other bulb. Make sure to plug in and pair the master before you plug in or power on the satellite. Definitely would recommend to someone who just wants to easily put sound somewhere as a cheap invisible option where they wouldnt otherwise be able to get it as long as they understand exactly what theyre getting.

Overall, i think sengled should stick with JBL as their speaker supplier, I stayed away from their newer model not only because of cost but because they arent JBL. I think the app needs some big updates, and any future generations of these bulbs should include both bluetooth and wifi options. Wifi would make for better sound quality, reliability, and app usage. Also, i think an outdoor option would be nice, although if you have covered lights outside these would likely be fine, but if theyre recessed be prepared for that to impact the sound some.

reviews.reviewTitle: Eh, has its positives and negatives
reviews.reviewText:
Wanted this to put in my bathroom for a speaker. Tried to install it once and I couldn't get it to connect. Come to find out that there is a parent light and a daughter light. Once I figured that out, it was fairly easy to install.
Pros - Super bright light, easy to connect and play music.
Cons - Not the best quality speakers, cannot be used separately.

I was really hoping that I could have one in my bathroom and one in the kitchen/dining room, but both work together simultaneously, not separately. So what you have playing on one, also plays on the other. You also can't have different volumes on each of them either, whatever is on one is on the other as well. I also couldn't figure out how to connect the Alexa option. The whole reason I wanted it in my bathroom was so I could just tell Alexa to play something for me while showering/bathing. That way I didn't have to pull out my phone and risk water damage. Basically just a HUGE let down on what I wanted. I wound up putting the parent in my bedroom and just connect via Bluetooth, the other light bulb just sits in the box. Not completely a waste of money, but definitely not worth the $80. If you have a place that you could use both of them together like a kitchen or dining room and you don't care about Alexa options then this isn't a waste for you.
I thought they would be a plug and play but I don't have proper lights to use them. I also thought I could use with my tv. But I can,t. Need to send them back but don't know how.

CONS:
This has an app, but the app is separate from and the bulbs are not compatible with SENGLED Home. This item requires the SENGLED Pulse application and direct BlueTooth control. Further, they only accept one bluetooth connection at a time. "Alexa Disconnect" .. then connect bluetooth on your phone/tablet app, change dimming, volume (although the Echo device can also adjust volume) through the Pulse app, then "Alexa Connect" and play music.

Also, these bulbs produce heat that is not like the standard LED bulbs one might be familiar with.

Pros:
Sound is great, loud, easy to pair, and does what it says on the tin. The echo can certainly pair to them via bluetooth, but they're seen as bluetooth speakers and not dimmable from Alexa (At least, not in the way that other SENGLED Home bulbs are.)

The lights are brighter than the 60 watt equivalent SENGLED bulbs, but dimming to about 50% sets them about the same brightness.

reviews.reviewTitle: No app for Desktop PCs; No external audio controls; Light runs hot Overpriced;
reviews.reviewText:
The pair of Sengled Pulse LED Smart Bulbs were given to us new and unopened (and hard to open). Sound is not exceptional, and there is no way to adjust the volume or tone externally, or even shut the audio off without shutting the light off. And which light gives off a good amount of heat, and there is no external way to adjust it, which can only be done with the app. But there is no version for Desktop PCs. An the website does not show much help.

All in all, it is way over priced, and I think should cost maybe 35.00 at most for both right now.

What may be interest is that I used the Lovin Product USB Bluetooth Wireless Micro Adapter (bought from Amazon) to connect with in Windows 10 (look in the system tray by the clock and choose Add new...). And in Windows 10 you can go to Sound Settings (R. click on speaker icon in system tray) and hit App features (down the bottom) and make different media players use different audio devices (make sure you launch the ones you want first), so you can play more than one file at the same time, which is neat. But with no external audio control or external dimming feature then this audio light bulb is not very practical for that. The $20.00 Dosmix Enhanced Bass Retro Wireless Vintage Speaker looks to be far superior unless you want a audio light in one unit.

Thank God we can help others via reviews.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the original $100, but can’t beat it at $40
reviews.reviewText: I expected more when I read the 13 watt rated specs of speaker power. I have had other bulb speakers with the common 3-5 watts and I honestly couldn’t tell this was louder ( when only playing one speaker). Having both the master and satellite then you can tell the difference but not by much. It definitely has a cleaner sound, specially with the equalizer settings. Like others have said, the app does take a little while to find its speakers. I love jbl. I have it in my home theater surround sound and jbl is all I ever upgrade into my vehicles. So even though this was a little disappointing, it’s still very worth the discounted price I paid. If the link adapter wasn’t so expensive, I’d buy another set to use the satellite off it.

First of all to the majority of people these are going to be magical and amazing and would very much upgrade their homes or business in an impressive way.

These would be absolutely perfect in a waiting room, lobby, your kitchen, or a small restaurant. If that is your use case you should get these and try them out.

That being said...
1: Make sure you know your final design before you buy anything. Unfortunately Sengled plays this game where you are forced into this silly product funnel where you can't just buy the parts you need but have to buy them in multi unit kits.

Example: You buy the pair of Sengled Pulse bulbs and like them and now want to use them for your TV sound system. You can't just buy the unit that connects to your TV, you have to buy *another* pair of bulbs that also comes with the TV adapter.

I absolutely cannot stand product management that forces customers to second guess their initial purchase when trying to upgrade. It makes no sense. Just sell the TV adapter on its own, the same as the subwoofer adapter (which looks identical to the TV adapter btw, very confusing) is available by itself.

2: Annoying high pitch whine comes from one of my bulbs. Changing the dimmer setting on the bulbs in the Sengled app changes the volume and possibly frequency of the whine. I've noticed the lowest whine volume at app 34% and 69%, which leads me to believe this is some harmonic issue probably related to the 60Hz AC utility frequency most of us in North America get from our wall outlets.

It's not one of those things I can pretend I don't hear as the bulb is two feet from my ear hole. I don't remember this noise the day I initially set up the Sengled bulbs, but did notice by day three. Not sure if it developed over time or if I just hadn't noticed yet, but now I can't un-notice.

3: You absolutely need the subwoofer bridge unit and a powered subwoofer unless all you intend to listen to is classical music.

Wanted these for a while, received a coupon so decided to pick them up. Idea was to hook up to TV in workout room, but bulbs can only be controlled (brightness, sound) through app, so I needed to disconnect TV Bluetooth and connect phone every time I wanted to change the volume on the bulbs themselves. Super trash on dimmers, which it says to not use them with, but that’s all I have — nasty buzzing when not playing sound and cannot dim other lights at all as dimming a small amount cuts all power to these bulbs and they shut off. Sound is decent, can see a use for them in certain situations, just not mine. I returned them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for Theatre Room but needs to Alexa enabled
reviews.reviewText:
I use these for the theatre room and it works great. Nothing like watching High Castle with these.

Only problem is Bluetooth makes it a pain to turn off the light. I honestly only use these for wireless surround sound. It’s crazy simple to screw in a lightbulb and plugin the auxiliary cable to the tv.

It’s one of the few things I can’t control with Alexa though and it’s annoying. I wish the light and speaker could be registered as separate Alexa devices.

Sengled is killing it in the IOT game and should keep the pressure on Hue by innovating further with their hubs and speakers lights.

reviews.reviewTitle: Forward thinking design, Decent sound, Flawed execution
reviews.reviewText: I got hooked on Sengled lighting products which led me to buying the Sengled Solo Pulse (which I am very satisfied with) and I figured two would be even better to have so I bought these as well. I knew buying these what kind of great quality to expect based on all of the other Sengled products I own (25 bulbs in total), but unfortunately the sound quality of these speakers left me disappointed. I didn't have them installed on a dimmer switch and even put my solo where I was trying these pair and sure enough, these didn't have the same kind of quality in sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: Go with a better quality system don't buy
reviews.reviewText: So your saying I have to pay the same price for a satellite single bulb as if I buy a pair of a master and a satellite. WT... ...that's so wrong . I only need a satellite but I have to pay the same price if I was buying a set come on really why... The don't even sound that great.
