I would buy again
I love mines 2 of my sisters came to visit me and they know how much I love my music 🎶 all around my house. Needless to say I had to order them a pair for their house. I have a feeling that I’ll have to buy more if and when my other sisters come visit. Also I’ve seen someone say they had a hard time pairing it with the Alexa you can only have it paired to one app at a time my work fine with my google and Alexa app

reviews.reviewTitle: but for wonderful yard filling music (quite loud for their size)
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased a Master/Satellite set for my new screed-in porch. I did not want speakers which had to be wired in or bulky rechargeable blue-tooth speakers. I found these and figured with JBL speakers, these should be OK. They have exceeded my expectations. Mind you they will not replace my Cerwin-Vega E315's for inside, but for wonderful yard filling music (quite loud for their size), TV sound, or streaming radio, they are worth more than the price I paid. There is not much bass but the app has a pre-programmed EQ which evens out the sound very acceptably. Remember these are not $500 speakers.

The lighting was my only real concern as they appear to only cast the light straight down, this is not the case. With only two bulbs, there is more than enough light for the 30' x 15' porch. We usually have the light set at 50% which is nice for relaxing comfort but still plenty to read or commiserate by. At 100% there is plenty of light to have company and play cards or eat dinner. Also after turning off the lights at our inside wall switch, when turning them back on, the lights come back on at the last setting.

The app is also very easy to use. The ability to make each bulb a right side or left side speaker or make each or just one a mono speaker is great when listening to Oldies which were recorded in Hi-Fi stereo. you can even mute just on or the other or both if you need to. All of my audio apps work great with them. If you are on the fence about whether of not to add these to you home, you won't be sorry you did, and your friends will be jealous!

One downside, the bulbs only have the one color, Warm White. Would like to see them come out with the RGB as well in the future. Then buying would absolutely be a no-brainer!

These speaker bulbs are a great design, but after useing for many months now in every application find them to be substandard at very best. They constantly lose connection wich gets very aggravating most of the time. I would really suggest if you want something like this to choose another company. This company will treat you like garbage at their customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product supported by outstanding customer service
reviews.reviewText: It didm't work right out of the box and that was initially frustrating. After a quick email to the company, I received a rapid reply to return the product to them so they could inspect and send back a new set to me. It turns out I needed to use an inexpensive, extension piece from Home Depot/Lowes/etc so that the unit could actually come in contact with the inside of the light (this is apparently a relatively common occurrence and if you have a problem with it not working, I suggest starting there). A minor annoyance, but it turned out fine. More important to me, I received an unprompted phone call from Alex at the company to walk through the issue and help me problem solve it after I had sent in the lights. To me, that is rare and outstanding customer service. He held me on the line while he consulted a colleague and was able to determine that I need the extension. So now, they work fantastic and the ability to quickly set up a "whole house" audio is achievable. Don't expect it to sound like a superior stereo system, it is missing a bit of bass, but it isn't any worse than my sound bar with bluetooth. Moreover, I can use my phone to control the volume on a room by room basis, really cool stuff. So, overall, I think this is a great product to put background music into each of your rooms on a relatively cheap basis without tearing out wall/ceiling etc for wiring. I will definitely be buying more satellites. If you do buy this product and need help, call their office in Alpharetta GA and ask fro Alex (but first try the extension trick). Super guy and great service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, replaces spot lights and provides wireless speakers in new places.
reviews.reviewText:
Are these unbelievably cool? Yes they are. So why four stars you ask? While they are cool, they could be improved so they aren't 5 star yet.

First off these work well.

The light part works as expected. Just to be clear, these are designed to replace flood/spot lights normally found in cams on the ceiling. While they may work in other places such as bedside lamps (stereo coolness!) they are large enough that many lamps won't support their size AND the LED light is designed to work like most LED bulbs do which means light comes out one direction only. So if you install these in your lamp, expect no light in the shade but instead all light goes straight up at the ceiling.

The speakers are decent for the size. You need to compare these more against normal in-ceiling speakers (which don't sound so wonderful) than other bluetooth speakers or higher end speakers. I would say the speakers sound like $15-$20 speakers (each) which is about what you expect. I would love to be impressed with the audio quality but instead it was about as expected with a tinniness and a "small" sound lacking bass. For the price of these, I was hoping for a bit better to be honest.

The app is simple and works well. I do not have any complaints. Other similar (but cheaper) products include an actual remote control which could be useful in some situations. These are only controlled via the app.

What could be improved?

I wish the light output was brighter, esp since it is supposed to replace flood lights.
I wish there was a normal bulb replacement designed with all around light output to use in table lamps.
I wish they were waterproof/designed for outside use. Given the price point, being weather resistant would help justify the cost.
I wish these had better bass and overall sound. It seems like some companies are able to pull that off in smaller packages so why not Sengled+?

reviews.reviewTitle: Pulse Dimmable LED Light with Wireless Bluetooth Speakers (Pair), Powered by JBL, Pewter
reviews.reviewText: Pulse Dimmable LED Light with Wireless Bluetooth Speakers (Pair), Powered by JBL, Pewter are unique LED lights/Bluetooth speakers. They are heavier than regular light bulbs, so make sure your lamp, etc can take the weight. The Pewter is more of a silver and matches well with any lighting device. You have to download apps to run the brightness/sound you must download the Intuitive App for Light and Sound Control. Light and sound are controlled directly from the application, including the ability to adjust light dimming and sound volume, audio equalizer modes, and launch your favorite media players such as Pandora, Spotify and others directly from the Pulse mobile app. They are an innovative product. I'm curious to see how long they will last. I pair them with my ANDROID 2 smartphone without any problems. They are a bit pricey at $169 with Amazon Prime shipping and are not waterproof. Overall, a very cool product.

reviews.reviewTitle: NOT Smart bulbs and NOT Alexa compatible
reviews.reviewText:
False claim that this is Alexa compatible, it only connects via bluetooth for sound. You can not tell Alexa to turn on/off the lights or sound. Even more disturbing is that because its bluetooth, you can not use app to change volume if it is connected to another source
I got the set for $30 in a deal, so dont mind keeping it as long as both speakers work fine. $100 would be waste of money

reviews.reviewTitle: Light up the room and fill it with quality sound.
reviews.reviewText:
This Product game into my life while at a SXSW Party with free BBQ / Beer and Good Music. The sound is something that can't go unnoticed, I have owned my speakers for 2 months now and aside from the sound the Bluetooth is strong. I can turn the lights on from the down stairs in the parking lot and I live on the 3rd floor. I use that feature when I'm getting home and I want to turn the lights on and I think its a great quality.
Ability to link up to 8 bulbs is impressive and the app for the phone doesn't seem to crash and updates are fairly often. I believe this investment is worth it!

[...]

I dislike that it was shipped without asking me on Voltage capacity as my country ( Jordan ) is 220V and the product support 120V

It could have been better if there is a transmitter with it to aviod buring them before even trying them 😔 yes this happened to me both lamps burned when i turn on the light 3secinds and both lights burned and didnt get the chance to test it ,,

The color temp is a lil too warm for my interior but they worked out perfectly for my hot tub area and decks. They provide a very bright light when needed. Good clean sound, 70-80% volume is just right for a small party without disturbing the neighbors. They do have some bass surprisingly but if you want to thump then get a wireless sub but they’re fine as is. I wish I needed more especially at this price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Charmed by The Light / Music Combo
reviews.reviewText:
So let me start by saying this really is a nifty idea/set-up. I mean there are other products out there but these are juts pretty cool

So let's talk about the physicality of the lights. They're big and they're heavy. Both of my lamps handed them fine but the front of the bulb just stick out just past the floor lamp. It's barely noticeable and my guest would not ever see it from the exact side that you would notice this on.

Now the Pulse App worked pretty well. I could make the lights dimmer or brighter, raise and lower the sound without any problems at all. Although the App does allow you to connect to other DLNA devices, and it saw my desktop... that was not flawless. It took a very long time to load the music from the folders there and unlike my Sony BluRay home theater set-up, this app doesn't seem able to bring in my playlists so it just wanted shuffle through my entire library which I never do. The good news is, you can use any Application you want on your device to pay the music, you just need to run the Pulse App to do work the lights and could do the music as well. I used Amazon's Music playor to do this myself.

Speaking of Amazon. I couldn't find this app on the Amazon App store. I search online to see if anyone else had any luck with it. Without going into side-loading, I just didn't see a way to get it on my Amazon Fire tablet which would be preferrable, for me, over my smartphone. This is really unfortunate on Amazon's part.

The sound is not bad, not really on par with the Solemate or Altec Lansing iMW555-BLK. I have both of those. This isn't really a knock against the device so much admitting you're sacrificing in one area to gain that light functionality.

Now for functionality, I really wish there was an alarm setting to the Pulse app. I mean having the lights pop and music blare would be great. This of course would be a nice feature to have but not a minus against the product as is. What is though are some assumptions made by the company in regard to the product. Now I believe they're estimating 3 hours a day, like a typical light in terms of getting maybe 22 years of use out of it... except this isn't a typical light is it. I might not leave lights on all day, but I would certainly listen to music for longer than hours at a time, easily. The other thing I am noticing is no real buttons on the device... which isn't really necessary right, except I don't see a way to reset the device. I am not talking about technology out pacing it in 22 years which is bound to happen but really, pairing devices. Bluetooth has a maximum, so if you can't unpair a device from the device itself, say your phone actually died, you're going to hit that max certainly within 22 years. Pulse could very well have a solution for this, but I have not found it readily available, yet.

Anyway, this is cool. If you have someone that likes neat AND functional gadgets, this does work as advertised, and it's pretty good at it too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Clever product - Fills a niche I didn't know existed
reviews.reviewText:
I live on the west side of a steep hill - a hill that blocks FM signals coming from NYC. As a news junkie, I listen to NPR in the morning since so much happens over night that I want to (need to) know about. The reception is spotty and easily affected by rain, snow, and (I think) sun spots! Frustrating... I have WiFi in the house and lots of Bluetooth connected devices like my tablet, smart phone and MP3 player - each of which has web access and NYC radio broadcasts. We have spotlights in the master bath so I screwed these ingenious bulbs in, downloaded the App from the web and was listening to crystal clear FM broadcasts in 10 minutes. Wow!

And, yes, you need the App. It lets you adjust volume, dim the lights (you are warned to NOT put the bulbs in a dimming socket) and even shut the lights off while maintaining the sound. Cool!

The sound quality is acceptable - better than the table radio that was in the bathroom but not really HiFi.

One star for the creativity. Two stars for the ease of installation and use (I love the tone that sounds when you turn on the lights), One star for the sound quality (wish it was a little better). The only thing that hurts is the price - It's expensive.

Recommended

reviews.reviewTitle: As Easy to Install as a Light Bulb
reviews.reviewText:
Overall I love them with a few disappointments:
Currently there is no Kindle app. The app makes it so that you can do more with the speaker bulbs besides just having them on or off.
The sound quality is really amazing when you consider what you are getting, but not very loud. Turned all the way up, they were just loud enough to be listened to over my running fan. The resulting sound was tinny at times.
While you can install these virtually anywhere you would a standard light bulb, there is the issue of size. These are much larger in width than a standard light bulb & do not fit in all of my light fixtures.
I am currently using them in pendulum style lighting in my office which is great for the surround sound effect when using both speakers, but the light is concentrated down. This means it does not spread light throughout the room like a regular bulb (the sides are blocked from projecting light as you can see in the pictures). Use of the app can take care of the light, but if you have the lights to also light your space this could be an issue.
Aside from these minor irritations, I'm pretty impressed with the ease of use & how well they blend right in creating sound out of "thin air".

Terrible! Great idea but lacking technology to support these speakers. Got two sets throughout the house. One never did connect properly and the others would lose the bluetooth connection. I run close to 300 mbps on my internet so that’s not the issue. Fix the technology and get these up to speed and these will be amazing!

reviews.reviewTitle: Crap, but decide for yourself (see video) three sets ...
reviews.reviewText: Crap, but decide for yourself (see video) three sets of two purchased by my husband for Christmas gifts. I kept opening new boxes hoping that it was just a defective set. Called cox hoping it was my cable, nope! I have the fastest streaming cable. Of course they don't have a tech or customer support number to call. High hopes dashed... If Customer service exist, please contact me before all the boxes are returned on Thursday because I really wanted these to actually play music.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow Factor Combined with Good Sound Makes This a Great Idea
reviews.reviewText:
When I upgraded from my aging iPhone this summer, I kept the old phone because it seemed like a lot of things needed apps downloaded and the iPhone worked just fine for this purpose when attached to my wifi. As a result I now use it as a sort of universal remote and now to control light and sound with these bluetooth speakers/lights.

When moving around the house I used to wear a bluetooth headphone that if I got too far away from my phone or tablet or walked through doorways used to fizz and cut out briefly which was annoying. Now I have these speakers set up in the two areas that I most frequent so I can listen to streaming internet radio/music/audio books without that annoying cut out.

I installed the bulbs/speakers by simply screwing them into two lamps. They are a bit large and they feel unusually heavy. Then I downloaded the free app. It's called Pulse by Sengled+, which might be helpful to know because I inadvertently downloaded something called Mobile Pulse when I first tried the set up.

The bluetooth paired and connected easily.

I was impressed by the sound. The light is also quite pleasant. The ability to control both with my phone or tablet is a great bonus.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't believe it, but I can't live without these
reviews.reviewText:
These are crazy crazy cool.

Who'd have thought that lightbulbs with speakers in them would be a good idea. Or even something that people would need/want. Well, it is. At first I thought, well, maybe for like a DJ or for parties, and yeah, these could be used in that sort of application, and I'd love to see LED lights/speakers for that specific application too. But these here are for more everyday home and business use.

I installed these in a kitchen/dining area with a sliding door to an outdoor deck. They're easy to control from my phone, which is where I'm streaming the music from, with the app - so the speaker volume and light brightness can be easily changed. In the summer we often eat on the deck, and with the door open the speakers are powerful enough to be heard outside.

Previous to this I would just have my phone volume cranked up and then bring it from the kitchen where I was cooking out to the deck to eat, but the quality was never great and I had to carry it with me. Now I can leave the phone on the table and enjoy music through the high quality and clear speakers while I'm cooking, or entertaining, or eating, or cleaning up. So awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doubtful Thomas here....but color me doubtful no more....
reviews.reviewText:
I confess; I was dubious. But the Pulse Dimmable LED Lights with Wireless Bluetooth Speakers were easy to install and they give a respectable sound.

The bulbs fit into a standard socket - ours are in a ceiling and ceiling fan fixture. Get them in place, download the ap, and stream from Bluetooth. That was it. No modifications required.

They take up no space whatsoever. And they can even be dimmed (using the ap).

We compared the sound quality with our Kindle Fire and our Bose Wave system. Bose of course can in first, followed by the ceiling fan (aka Wireless Bluetooth bulbs), and the Fire came in a poor third.

This is a convenient way to have music on the porch or patio, in the kitchen or bath, or in a child's room.

Four stars - they're a bit pricey and the sound isn't the best out there. But they're fun and the sound is good enough for our parties and barbeques. And 'pricey' is, as always, a personal call.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for recessed ceiling lights, good sound, good lights!
reviews.reviewText: These Bluetooth speakers work great, at first I wondered about how good a light bulb could sound offering lighting at the same time. You'll need to download the app (Pulse) before using the speakers. The App controls the light via a dimmer from your phone or Tablet, I'm using both my iPad and iPhone 5 without a hitch. Linking up the bluetooth was easy,the app connects automatically once set up. Sound is much better than I was expecting, just don't expect deep base but overall having the ability to add great sounding wireless speakers to my recessed ceiling lights is a wonderful idea. Great for waiting rooms so you can entertain people waiting without the expense of having it wired and mounting speakers, everyone will wonder where the music is coming from. Now to the lights, the LEDs put out natural color light we're use to having from regular tungsten filament bulbs (4200K) they offer plenty of light and can be dimmed via the Pulse App!

Seemed like a great idea. But for the price, it should deliver more/better. The Bluetooth connection startup is inconsistent- sometimes when you come into range, it links, other times, you have to manually connect with your device. There are only pre-set equalization choices, and the overall sound is rather flat. I'm comparing it to my Amazon Echo and my Pandora radio, not my stereo. Also, you can only turn the speakers on/off, not balance the audio levels individually. The light is a warm white as indicated, so it replaces an incandescent bulb as well or better than my other LEDs. There is a slight hum from the bulbs when music isn't playing- that's not acceptable. Though I've found a useful place in my home for it, and do use it, I would not recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only worked for a little over a month
reviews.reviewText: We loved these when we got them, they worked for about a month and a half and now they don't work at all. Our phones won't even find them up via Bluetooth. We called the company and they gave us troubleshooting instructions which didn't work and since we've had them for over one month we can't return them. The reviews in the app store all say the same thing, that they can't connect to the light bulb, so the bulbs don't work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound is good, but bulbs are big and don't seem to fit in many light fixtures
reviews.reviewText:
I was excited about these light bulb speakers because they seemed like a convenient way to bring wireless sound to any room in my house. Unfortunately, they haven't proven to be as convenient or versatile as I was hoping. Yes, they can screw into any E26 socket, but they are larger than a standard bulb and the ventilation in the bulb can't be blocked. So in reality, I'm finding very few places in my house these are compatible with. (And I say that as someone who lives in a condo that was gut rehabbed in 2004 and has a lot of built in lights.) My hope was to use these in the bathroom since outlets there are at a premium, but they were far too big to fit into my light fixture. I'm also not sure why the product description on this page says to use them on terraces, patios and balconies when the instructions that come with the lighting say they are only to be used indoors. Basically, I think the marketing is misleading when they say they can be used in any socket, because that is just not what I am finding from my own experience. My advice would be to take the dimensions and actually measure your intended space to make sure they will actually fit before ordering.

That said, when I finally found a socket where they fit, the experience was pretty good. The app is intuitive and doesn't seem buggy or slow. And the sound quality is pretty good. I also have a few other speaker systems in my house and I do think that my Bose SoundDock 10 Bluetooth Digital Music System,Bose® Acoustimass® 10 Series IV home entertainment speaker system - Black, and Sony HT-CT660 46-Inch Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer sound better. But I expected that based on the difference in price points and the presence of a subwoofer with my Bose Acoustimass and Sony HT-CT600 systems. These definitely don't have that level of richness or base. However, I do think they sound very good overall for what they are and the price point. If you are a hardcore audiophile these likely will disappoint you, but for the average listener I think they sound pretty good and we tried a range of music from R&B to folk rock to rap to rock. We haven't really been able to use the dimmer function as these only fit in my overhead can lights where they are two lights of many so dimming just two doesn't really make sense. It seems like you'd need to replace all the lights on a single switch to really have this feature make sense, which is a bummer because I do love being able to control my lights wirelessly. I have the Belkin WeMo Light Switch, Control Your Lights From Anywhere with the Home Automation App for Smartphones and Tablets, Wi-Fi Enabled installed on a different light and it is awesome.

Overall, I think this is a cool idea and the sound quality you get is good for the price. I only wish the lights where smaller so they would be compatible with more light fixtures or that they would come out with different sizes because that would really increase the versatility, especially if you are a renter who plans to use them as you move from place to place.
I wanted to like these but if you are not playing music they just make a small faint humming noise that will drive you crazy when you notice it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not ready for primetime. Satellite speaker inop.
reviews.reviewText:
I really wanted to like this product as it would have fit well in my workshop and provide audio where I didn't want to run speaker wires. Alas, despite trying every tech solution possible, the Satellite speaker would not pair with the Master or be recognized by the Android Pulse app or my tablet Bluetooth. Sengled tech support was very responsive, but to no avail. Sound from the Master speaker/LED was OK, but no where near as good as a cheap full-sized speaker. Lumen output was too dim to really add usable light to my workshop. Had to return it.

Hopefully Sengled will come out with a version of these LED/speaker combos with more lumens and a separate Bluetooth woofer. Their website says a woofer is in the works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coolest speakers ever! This is the bomb!
reviews.reviewText:
This is one of the coolest new products I've seen. It's both a light and a speaker. Just screw the base into a desk or ceiling lamp (you get two) and then when you use your device, they light up and play music as well as provide light. They look really cool and can dim and work as a strobe too if you wish. So much more useful than just speakers on a cabinet.

I put these in my son's room and with his Iphone he really was surprised at how good the sound was and how crisp the light was. Seriously great invention....I've seen NOTHING like this before. Plus, it's easy to move around to another room: just unscrew and find another lamp. The lamp itself doesn't have to be anything special, and no batteries are required.

I can't help but think that if these were in a dorm, they wouldn't get stolen either...after all, who would know that the lightbulb was a speaker!

Highly recommend! I'm getting a pair for my room and also it works with many different inputs like tablets and MP3s. Coolio!

We purchased for our mountain hot tub room. Wanted something that didn't require a socket to use and did not want to have to bring BT speakers everywhere. They are hooked up to our dimmable light switch and works without fail. Incredible happy with the product. Exceeded our expectations. Our room is not huge so the speakers fill the void well. I like that while in the hot tub we can dim lights and still have music. The APP works great with this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Audio and simple setup...and now my neighbors are jealous
reviews.reviewText: The setup and connection is brain dead simple and the quality is great compared to other BT speakers. Very convenient to have in the ceiling as the audio fills the room and no clutter on the kitchen counter. Kids are now asking for their own set upstairs.

This is a perplexing product, and I wasn't sure how they'd work.

It's essentially a light bulb and speaker in one product.

It was easy to pair the speakers with my iPod. I especially like that I can use them as exterior LEDs on my screened porch, pair it, and then have music for a party, while I'm gardening, etc.

I'm a bit of a sound snob, and these don't come close to my sound bar, but the sound isn't horrible, and the convenience factor is definitely there.

I was torn between giving these four or five stars and decided on the five because of the coolness factor. It's a futuristic kind of thing that makes me wonder not only how it works but also who came up with the idea.

reviews.reviewTitle: Innovative Product Solves My Kitchen's Audio System Issues
reviews.reviewText:
We recently went through a kitchen upgrade and my wife lost her under-cabinet speaker system - mostly because I didn't want to put it back up again :o) It was dated and I was having difficulty finding a suitable compact plug in replacement. The only other requirement was that the speakers permit bluetooth connectivity.

Enter the Pulse-JBL LED speakers. Our past experience with JBL has been good. They develop compact innovative solutions like the JBL OnBeat Air iPad/iPod/iPhone Speaker Dock with AirPlay and JBL On Stage 200ID High-Performance Speaker Dock for iPhone 4/4S and iPod (Black) series. They don't have the punch for a large room, but deliver great sound in a 15' x 12' bedroom.

I replaced 2 of 4 recessed BR30 CFLs in our open kitchen layout with the Pulse-JBLs. The CFLs are about 2 years old and might have decreased in intensity, but the 8w/600 Lumens LEDs were keeping up in brightness with the 23W/1300 Lumen CFLs. Standing in the kitchen we did not notice any one side brighter than the other. Both lamps are 2700K in color and depending on the manufacturer it is listed as "warm white" or "bright white" - they both have a slight yellow tinge in them.

The speaker setup is simple. Switch on the bulbs, switch on the bluetooth on your device, pair with the speakers and play your music through them. The sound quality is good! It will not please your teenager and definitely not an audiophile, but it is perfect for our application. My wife loves listening to her music while working in the kitchen and these produce good enough sound for her to enjoy her music. They are not tinny sounding and being installed in a recessed fixture does bump up the bass. Also, being installed in the ceiling they sound much larger and provide greater coverage - which is not possible with any under-cabinet or counter-top system where the speakers are next to each other.

The LEDs are dimmable via your wall switch as well as through the free Pulse App available in your app store. The pulse app permits you to control light dimming, sound volume and provides 6 EQ settings. Your device's native EQ settings will also work. The app does a lot to be desired. Since my application does not require dimming the lights, I am using my device's native interface instead of the app for volume/sound control.

For those looking to install these in any other application (floor lamps, etc.), note that these are BR30 bulbs that provide light in one direction. If you put these in a floor lamp, it will only light up your ceiling.

Lastly, you cannot have multiple devices connected at the same time. You have to disconnect the connected device to add a new one or atleast the connected device has to be out-of-range (more than 25 ft)

Recommended!

Pros:
* Concealed speakers in a compact LED bulb add an invisible, wired solution to your home without any modifications
* JBL Speakers provide good sound for casual listening - not tinny!
* LED bulb is dimmable via a wall dimmer or the free app
* Bluetooth permits you to stream any audio content from your device
* 8W LED consumption is eco friendly and keeps your bills low

Cons:
* Cannot connect multiple devices simultaneously and have each device override the other
* Pricey
* Would be a 5-Star product, had it got a better app, was a little cheaper (~$125) and/or had color LEDs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Slighty confusing sound quality with nice dimming lights
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased the pair from Costco. I didnt know what to expect but was too curious to not try them. I screwed them into my 2 living room lamps (keep in mind they are bigger than regular bulbs when planning placement), got the app and went for it. The dimming feature is nice, and they can remember the previous dim setting.

Sound, its close to being really good. The app has an equalizer which helps some. They of course dont have much bass. There is a slight hum sound but with music playing you don't notice it. Vocals are kinda hollow, muffled, just a bit off, not quite sure how to describe. I just tried an audio book and the voice was kinda hard to understand, yet classical music sounds great if that helps?

They are soooo close to sounding really good, I bet after the next few app updates they will have the equalizer nailed down. I *think* I'm happy with them. It is nice to have speakers without additional cords around

*Update 1-22-16: I've now been playing with them for a week. I'm trying to talk myself into liking them but the more I listen to them the worse they sound. The only genre that sounds good is Classical. Otherwise the vocals are lost and washed out unless you are running them at like 80% full volume, but for the price that's horrible and I know I don't want that high volume all the time. My IPhone's speaker is way more clear. The app also doesn't remember your last volume setting so one you turn on the Bluetooth you have to go adjust it again, AND the speakers don't automatically connect to bluetooth so yoy have to select them each time. If they don't receive an app update that improves sound quality by the time my Costco Return period is up, I'm taking them back.

Wow. I didn’t even know something like this existed. I guess I need to spend more time in Austin! I got these primarily for a 250 square foot master bathroom where I like to listen to podcasts while I shower, brush my teeth, etc. Prior to these I was using a laptop with volume enhancers to overcome the noise of the shower that never quite worked depending on the volume output of the particular podcast. These solved the problem!

There is essentially no installation. If you can screw in a light bulb and download an app, you’ll be fine. The speakers are energy efficient, sound great, look great (clean soft white), and save space! As someone who hates clutter, these are perfect.
Barely lasted two months before the satellite stopped working (no sound / can't connect to master).

First off, the sound is amazing. It is much richer and deeper than I would have ever imagined. Also, the software for the bulbs is easy to use and very sleek looking.

However, the bulbs emit a high pitch whine whenever the LEDs are on. I called support and got a rep in the phone (very quickly, I might add) who said this was a known issue and there was nothing they could do to fix the problem.

As such, I can't recommend these. I got them as a Christmas present and will be sending them back.

JBL speakers sound good descent for the living room or small area. Like the feature to add satalite bulbs so you can build your speakers. The light is not bright white it’s a soft white and dims perfectly recommend as a good Xmas gift .

reviews.reviewTitle: the sound was not good, it makes weird high pitch noise when it ...
reviews.reviewText: Bought The set in color red,the sound was not good,it makes weird high pitch noise when it gets 80% volume,I really want these to work!! Do I need to try buying another set?

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: The quality of the product is excellent. the seller and the excellent attention and the delivery time is outstanding, highly recommended. the highest qualification

reviews.reviewTitle: These bulbs are simple to install and easy to use
reviews.reviewText:
How nifty is this? Light bulbs that also function as Bluetooth-enabled speakers! These bulbs are simple to install and easy to use. You can control the music and the lighting through a smartphone app. The sound is pretty good, not quite Bose-level quality but more than acceptable. Make sure you have right fixtures before ordering though.

(Also, think of the horrible, horrible pranks you could play with these...)
I really like the product. Easy to install the units and app. Easy to use. But just after the return deadline passed, one unit died. No light, no sound and no way to return.
I love how they sound and the app is very easy to use, they can definitely change the mood around your place while you are using them.
Purchased 4 of these with the sub woofer adapter for my out door deck. Amazing sound and light. So i purchased more for inside my home. Also 1 day delivery.

I honestly had no idea something like this even existed. I love playing music, but hate the crappy sound I get from my phone. I have these installed in my dining room right now so that when I'm cleaning, cooking, or folding laundry, I can hear my music! They work much better than I expected. The light is like natural daylight and I love it! The sound is incredible! Very easy to set up. I'd give it 6 stars if I could!
These are about the coolest thing in my new house. Music literally everywhere I go. Love love love it.

Yes they work... and the sound quality is much better than I expected.

My only problem is that these lights are just too big to place in the fixtures that I would prefer. They either don't fit at all in some downward facing light receptacles, or they extend beyond the end of the track lights. They are awfully bright as well.

If they were smaller, I would love them. But as things stand now. I'll probably use them in a limited way.

They work great and the sound quality is excellent unfortunately they are a little large for some fixtures. Otherwise I really have no complaints. They are very easy to use and work really well for parties.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Sound Quality, lighting and app.
reviews.reviewText: We love these bulbs and the sound quality from the JBL speakers is awesome. The app provides full control from adjust the lighting levels to the multiple equalizer settings for the speakers.

These looked like an interesting approach to background music in our family room. There were only two problems.

The first became apparent immediately: the sound sucks. Terribly. You CAN find songs with limited frequency range that sound okay as background, but pick something with vocals (I tried Eagles music) and they're absolutely garbage.

The second issue is the deal breaker. After a couple weeks, the app does not see the devices and Bluetooth fails to connect from ANY of my devices.

Perhaps a nice science project, but pure rubbish. I'll be returning these today.

reviews.reviewTitle: Interesting LED light and speaker combo
reviews.reviewText: These JBL Bluetooth Speakers also have LED Lights which screw into any standard E26 socket. The wireless function is good for 30 feet, and are compatible with any Bluetooth enabled device. The speakers have 13 watts and are surround sound quality. I think these speakers would be a great option for parties and rooms used for entertaining guests.
Great price, good quality & good sound...perfect for my garage!!!
Coupon code: SAMSUNGVDAY saves you 34.00 plus free shipping on the manufacturers website.
They came on time and they work great

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointing....on their way back to Amazon
reviews.reviewText: Sadly I am returning these. Two things I love are lights and bluetooth speakers, so this seemed like a match made in Heaven. The speakers do sound good, however, I wasn't able to put the satellite speaker 1 room away without the sound cutting in and out. The lights put out an annoying high pitched buzzing sound that is more than I can overlook. I wanted these lights/speakers so that I could have my music playing throughout my house without buying an outrageously priced sound system. Unfortunately they can't be placed far enough apart to achieve this.

My original order arrived with one bulb/speaker not working (the satellite) and this was frustrating. After some back and forth and a couple of issues with customer service, they agreed to promptly replace and once that was determined, they arrived the next day. I was able to ship back the original pair without issue (on their dime) and they concurred they were faulty. This new pair is great! The master bulb paired quickly with the bluetooth on my iPad and iPhone and I also downloaded the "Pulse" software, which was easy (and free). The equalizers are basic and probably not worth messing with much. The sound quality is good. I have the master installed in my kitchen light fixture (the bulb is bulky but firm) and the satellite in an adjoining hallway. Great to have surround sound as you walk around the house. The top end is clear and the middle is good too. Bass is okay, but no real issue with that for the function these provide. Dimmer and sound controls on the software are handy, and I really have no complaints (now). Thanks, Sengled for remedying a customer issue promptly. Nothing inherently wrong with the product - I think I just got a faulty pair originally, and once the issue was corrected, am a happy customer.
Awesome they sound great easy to use worth the money
Great product. Sound is amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: They look really great in person and were very easy to connect
reviews.reviewText: I bought these as a gift for my husband (the man who has everything). They look really great in person and were very easy to connect. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay but not as good as other options
reviews.reviewText:
You install these 65~ watt bulbs in your lightbulb socket (warning: the dimensions are wider than normal so you need to make sure your fixture won't prohibit them going in-!) and turn Bluetooth on a device that uses speakers (mostly tablets, mp3 players, etc) and pair one bulb (the Master) with it.

The Master bulb synchs with the other one automatically.

The sound is fine for most music but it takes getting used to depending on your bulb location.

I don't recommend these bulbs to the average person even though they will last longer. These strike me as more specialized for young adults or teens or DJs or something.
Bought these for our son...he loves them!
Not work, only if there is a unique light with one switch. Waste of money.

This is a great concept. With space being limited more and more, being able to put compact speakers in places that you normally would not is a great idea. The problem is that the execution is terrible for the following reasons:

1. These are not waterproof and you cannot use outside (many people would like to use something like this on their patio.)
2. This is bluetooth and not wifi. Therefore you have to have a bluetooth device to use them and for most people, that is their cell phone.
3. The light has a small illumination area. I put this in a fixture that illumininates the entire room but the light is focused directly down and only illuminated that area.
4. Once the light goes out, you will have to replace the unit.
5. I never got the Master unit to connect with my cell phone.

Based on this, I would look for other products to do the same.

I was turned on to this product by a good friend of mine and they are truly amazing! I placed the pair in my patio with the hopes that they would be OK- was I wrong! The sound quality is great and the freedom to stream anything is fantastic.

The simple app that you download to control the brightness and volume are extremely simple to use that a non "techie" person would have no problems with it.

Set up for the pair took around 2 minutes and that was mainly for downloading the app.

I am looking to purchase another pair for my family room.
These are great 2 in 1 light and by speakers with desent sound considering very compact and the and combo. Use in my shower so no more boring baths. Also great bang for the buck
really good sound for a small device. connects easily to my phone and my alexa.
Great product
